body:
Hi @nalim2 closing this now, as i cherry picked the change directly into develop. Please consider to make a new PR from current develop for the next time, then it can be merged directly.
Nonetheless, many thanks for the fast fix! üëç
üéâ Congratz to your first MERGED PR Lukasz üëç

Hi,

could you please elaborate a bit about what this example does?
And sorry for not addressing this for so long ... has been quite busy lately ;-)

Chris

the example is a mechanism to continously fetch data from a S7. I and maybe a lot of other people have the following use case: we have some variables we want to read from the s7 and these are monitored, visualized e.g. so we fetch the same variables every second and output them.
* the code automatically reconnects when the connection is lost 
* there is sample code how to manually initialize the s7 driver in a osgi environment, where the mechanism of automatically loading the driver does not work
Hi @martinLim45 , thank you for the contribution and congratulation to you first merged PR üéâ .
Looks good to me ... and I did see it fail before and work with the change ;-)

Hi Julian

i tested your implementation in master and in your branch and watched open files with lsof as u did.
it looks like your solution fixes the problem.
I would like to test the issue vs a real device that loses connection due to Firewall topics or by physical  problem - network broken, lack of power. 

In general to avoid such kind of errors it will be great if can define some kind of tests that check those conditions.

thanks for your work!
checked my stuff quite detailed and found some bugs ... build is also now green so i'll merge that

Hi,

sorry for the long delay. last Friday I used your PR to get things working with sonarcloud.io ... I did have to change a few things (set the Variable in the "environment" block instead of using "def" ... but now it's working. 

Thank you very much for your effort. It helped a lot.

Chris
Happy that it worked!
Thank you Roman! üéâ
Looks good to me ... think perhaps Julian or Tim can help with your question if the while loop is the ideal solution.
Yeah ... have to admit I was just to lazy to find out where to put it ;-) ... thanks for this.

Excellent @vemmert ... I will try to review this ASAP.
@chrisdutz perhaps it makes sense if you check the site/documentation stuff as you currently work on it : )
Thank you... I will have a look when I‚Äôm back at the desk
Looks good and builds locally, will merge. Congrats @cschneider for your first merged PLC4X PR üéâ !
Its not intended to be merged, yet its. First, we should check it in-depth.
And I agree with you @chrisdutz with the naming. I just wanted to make the smalles changes possible which was base -> xxx.

How about throwing in a readme in the karaf features area? 
I would have expected to see some documentation around OSGI support as well at the top level somewhere

We already had "plc4j/integrations/apache-karaf" modules and there we were using the goal "features-generate-descriptor" which generates the "feature.xml" ... the way you're currently doing it would require to manually maintain a second resource with dependency information.
Ok ... I compared the feature.xml you added manually, that's identical to the one generated by the plugin, except that it has one additional entry:     <feature>scr</feature>
See https://github.com/jinahya/bit-io/pull/12
I would like to merge this ...
No objections, feel free or I will do it : )
@chrisdutz I cannot judge on the exact changes, it looks "ok". Did you run some tests against a PLC of yours (Logo?)? Otherwise I would try to do this later today or tomorrow...
The real thing was what I was able to reproduce the error and verify the fix against the real thing ... I wasn't able to reproduce it in the Unit-Test World however.

I tested it against the S7-1200 ... the logo is very restrictive ... it seems it doesn't have any graceful error handling ... as soon as it reads something it doesn't like, it hangs up without saying goodbye.
@cschneider woudl you mind if I merge your change into my osgi branch and close the PR there, then?

That ist fine

Julian <notifications@github.com> schrieb am So., 20. Okt. 2019, 14:11:

> @cschneider <https://github.com/cschneider> woudl you mind if I merge
> your change into my osgi branch and close the PR there, then?
>
> ‚Äî
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/plc4x/pull/90?email_source=notifications&email_token=AADWJ2GLY6YWLFM5QKOAU2DQPRDGDA5CNFSM4JAK6BO2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEBYIWKA#issuecomment-544246568>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AADWJ2H6P6IJZVQRRKLNV5DQPRDGDANCNFSM4JAK6BOQ>
> .
>
Thank you very much for the support @cschneider will merge!
Yeah ... no idea where that came from but without it it's looking for that class and fails.
@chrisdutz just checked everything and I like it. So I would merge it, if nobody else vetoes?
Hey @jixuan1989 the example looks good. What do you think about providing a Test to see if everything runs? I could also help you with that, if you like?

Oh, I just saw that you write against an existing instance.. so thats rather impossible, I guess... so it looks good to me otherwise and I will merge it. It would probably be cool to add an example to write into a tsfile, what do you think @jixuan1989 ?
And.. congratulations to your first plc4x PR üéâ !
@dependabot rebase
Just checked that it works... so if there are no objections I will merge it.

> Oh, I just saw that you write against an existing instance.. so thats rather impossible, I guess... so it looks good to me otherwise and I will merge it. It would probably be cool to add an example to write into a tsfile, what do you think @jixuan1989 ?

I will :D
Ah .... just saw your comment ... sorry for just doing it ...

It's fine when it's done : )
________________________________
From: Christofer Dutz <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 6, 2019 4:44:42 PM
To: apache/plc4x <plc4x@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Julian Feinauer <j.feinauer@pragmaticminds.de>; Comment <comment@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [apache/plc4x] Bump jackson.version from 2.9.9 to 2.10.0 (#97)


Ah .... just saw your comment ... sorry for just doing it ...

‚Äî
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/apache/plc4x/pull/97?email_source=notifications&email_token=AECOQCTLJOTIMTJR34HV5JDQSLQ6VA5CNFSM4JGPD5Z2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEDG7NYQ#issuecomment-550368994>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AECOQCV6FOYSNWMTWSR362TQSLQ6VANCNFSM4JGPD5ZQ>.

@vemmert looks good to me too : )
It would be nice to squash those commints into one to have fewer noise in the history (git rebase -i origin/develop). Is that okay for you?

> It would be nice to squash those commints into one to have fewer noise in the history (git rebase -i origin/develop). Is that okay for you?

Done.
thanks!
I think Julian as our Netty guru should review
@chrisdutz thanks for the hint, I added one comment :)

>  @acs did you try it against a modbus device?

I have tried it against the modbus server we use in our integration tests:

`docker run   --network=host  panterdsd/diagslave:latest "-p 1502:502" -e "PROTOCOL=tcp"`

but not yet against a modbus device written float data. Probably this float support won't cover all cases. Our idea is to continue improving it.
Okay, fine, then congratulations on your first merged contribution to PLC4X üéâ
Sorry @amrod- I was busy. I will go trhough it tomorrow in deep and then we can hoepfully finish and merge your work : )

> Okay, fine, then congratulations on your first merged contribution to PLC4X tada

Thank you @JulianFeinauer !
Hi C√©sar, thanks for this great PR ... we'll evaluate this.
I re-did the branch and merged it ...

some more potential release points:
in Ads2PayloadProtocol at the end of decode `byteBuf.release`
in Payload2SerialProtocol at the end of encode `amsPacket.release`
in Payload2TcpProtocol at the end of decode `byteBuf.release`

> some more potential release points:
> in Ads2PayloadProtocol at the end of decode `byteBuf.release`
> in Payload2SerialProtocol at the end of encode `amsPacket.release`
> in Payload2TcpProtocol at the end of decode `byteBuf.release`

No the super class (MessageToMessageCodec) will already call release see https://netty.io/4.0/api/io/netty/handler/codec/MessageToMessageDecoder.html
Hey Lukasz, this should go to rel/0.6 branch, I guess, or?
I spotted this bug with bacnet ip driver on develop but sure, it can be backported to 0.6 branch too.
@chrisdutz could you also have a look here. I thought we moved all this regex stuff to one central place (using java bultin classes). This approach would not allow us to parse path parameters, right?

@splatch LGTM but I'm just a bit confused that the regex is there in the first place, so let me shortly check why that is than we can merge it : )
For rel/0.6 I can merge it asap.

Well I split up the parts of the connection string ... the ip/hostname stuff should now be in the tcp and udp transport modules. Just can't immediately find it but in general the url is split up into {protocol}:{transport}://{transport-config}?{parameter-string}
Aaahh ... yeah ... just had a look ... of course ... The patch is for the Transport ... so this is exactly the place where it has to be fixed.
Since I've got thumbs up, I've pushed changes to develop. I will pray for jenkins to pass the build. ;-)

This code was not merged in develop branch and it is needed. With this PR we do it! Thanks @chrisdutz for the code and my fault not reporting after two days the results for the testing (I did it in the PLC4x ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/PLC4X/issues/PLC4X-156) blocking the merging of this code.
üëç LGTM, thank you @ottobackwards!
We have completely rewritten the S7 driver in the develop branch ... I think starting with the 0.7.0 releases this will no longer be an issue.
Also I've opened this [JIRA issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PLC4X-178) because I'm facing some problems with building Docker :<
@JulianFeinauer is there any particular reason for the structure of `plc4py`? It's not very python-like :)

Hi,

so please help me understand the problem here. The docker image specified in the dockerfile is no longer available and by using any java 8 version the build works again?

Chris

> so please help me understand the problem here. The docker image specified in the dockerfile is no longer available

@chrisdutz that's correct. I could not found the tag here: https://hub.docker.com/r/azul/zulu-openjdk/tags

>by using any java 8 version the build works again?
> 

At least it starts... but I have not been able to make it work yet.

Ah ok ... well I guess that they only host the most recent versions and remove old ones (Not that familiar with the Docker ecosystem). So I guess by just providing "8" as version it will take the most recent Java 8 version, correct?

> So I guess by just providing "8" as version it will take the most recent Java 8 version, correct?

Yes
LGTM ... thanks for finding and reporting this.
LGTM, you can merge üéâ

@nuclearpinguin first off, hi Thomascz, nice to have you here : ) And in fact, when we started with python (no one had a clue about python), @chrisdutz and I made the structure as we know it from java / maven. So thats rather historic reason.

Hi @nuclearpinguin,

I always thought that it would be great if someone who actually knew a language would at least help with the API in order for it to feel right. So I'm fine with any changes you propose. However it would be great if it would stay possible to build the project with maven as the code generation will have to be done with maven and as long as all is located in one repo, that we can do a CI build with all parts in one run.

Chris

@chrisdutz can I find somewhere detailed information on how the code generation works? 

@JulianFeinauer thanks for the info, I will refactor the PLC4py. I will also familiarize myself with maven and the whole project structure.

I'd suggest starting here: https://plc4x.apache.org/developers/code-gen/index.html
And then digging though some existing drivers. 
@JulianFeinauer started writing up a tutorial, which hasn't progressed very far here:
https://plc4x.apache.org/developers/tutorials/writing-driver.html
Will this branch be merged? Or is the /develop branch supporting S7 Subscription?
No this branch can't be merged as the files it refers to have been deleted ... It's a work in progress which will be converted to mspec and the new generated drivers as soon as it's done.
I have applied the changes you told me, hope everything is fien now

Yes, no problem!

Julian <notifications@github.com> schrieb am Sa., 29. Feb. 2020, 13:57:

> *@JulianFeinauer* approved this pull request.
>
> LGTM. Would you mind adding a line to the RELEASE_NOTES file and merge
> then?
>
> ‚Äî

I kind of like it to get feedback ;)

For my defense there is already an OpcuaFieldTest. But those tests are missing!
i will add them and come back
So how far are we on this?
The missing code is generated by thrift as part of the maven build.
LGTM <3
Thanks <3
Sry I did an error. I am trying to start from current dev and add the S7 String parsing.
You're right ... that's a relict from graduation ...
I'm going to close this one as the problem is no longer applicable to the new S7 driver.

Oh gee .. I can't believe how long this has been open .. I am extremely sorry for that. 
I just had a look and to me it seems as if the same thing you are addressing here is also being done by the "scraper" component in PLC4X ... I just saw that it's still 100% undocumented on the website, but you can see in the Logstash and Kafka Connect adapters on how to use it.
Any progress on bringing this to mspec?

> 
> 
> Any progress on bringing this to mspec?

Hi Chris,

At this moment I am migrating Merlot to use the PLC4X driver model, as soon as I finish I will carry out load tests for the S7 driver, to later migrate to mspec and be in line with the rest of the project.

Work in progress... :-)

I'm closing this one since it is not required to get ADS handling. Basic fields which are assembled to bit, byte or int types can be mapped using a receiving order without need to swap byte positions.
I'm fine to merge this and move on
I am open to suggestions on how to write a test for this
LGTM
The thing with this is that now you can't build without tests ... I intentionally built it that way, that you can do a maven build and skip tests ...
Perhaps inverting the logic and allowing to disable tests would be an option ...
OK, I'll add that.
never mind
Thanks @patrickse ! Do we have integration tests for milo or did you test the code already?
I am not aware of any integration test. We've changed the dependency and deployd it to our platform. It looks ok for now. How could I implement an integration test?
